moves.1. e4 e5 2. Qh5 Nc6: The only thing you can do against 2. Qh5.
moves.3. Bc4 Nh6 4. d4 Bb4+ 5. c3 Bd6 6. Bxh6: ?? Obviously didn't see my queen. He told me so in a comment after he'd committed to the move.
moves.22... Qxe8+ 23. Kf2: The hunt is on. But there are things I must be careful of. I have to keep pressure on the king so White does not move the queen knight and join his rooks together.
moves.23... Rxd5: Now I have two files open, controlling two squares on White's back rank.
moves.24. Re1 Qd8 25. g4 Bxf5: This sac of my bishop opens up a third file for my remaining rook.
moves.26. gxf5 Rxf5+ 27. Kg1: I was expecting 27. Ke2 Re6#, but no problem, I still have mate in two with 27. Rg6  28. Kh1 Qd5#.
